bug.author: Aaronsom
bug.summary: "leave_out" in an adapter config does not work if config is a dict
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>Information</denchmark-h>
BertEncoderAdaptersMixin.add_adapter() checks for "leave_out" with hasattr. This does not work if the config is a dict because then it is no attribute. <denchmark-h:h2>To reproduce</denchmark-h>
adapter_config = resolve_adapter_config("pfeiffer") adapter_config["leave_out"] = [0, 1] #adapter_config = AdapterConfig.from_dict(adapter_config) model.add_adapter(name, AdapterType.text_task, config=adapter_config) If the third line stays commented out, then the 0th and 1st layer will not be skipped in BertEncoderAdaptersMixin.add_adapter(). <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
A dict config should work with "leave_out" especially if resolve_adapter_config returns a dict.
